question.content: My sister resembles to my mother a lot in looks and in ||| temperament. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: resembles ||| The verb ‘resembles’ does not take the preposition ‘to’ after it. ||| Hence, ‘resembles’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Effective communication is a skill that can significant ||| enhance your personal and professional life. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: which can significantly enhance ||| The given sentence needs an adverb(significantly) to modify the ||| verb (enhance) and not an adjective (significant). Hence, ‘which ||| can significantly enhance’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: We have received no information so far to the main island. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: so far from ||| ‘From’ is used with ‘receive’ to indicate the source destination or ||| sender. In the given sentence, ‘the main island’ is the source ||| destination from which no information has been received so far. ||| Hence, ‘so far from’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: When he was falsely accused of embezzlement, he was ||| beside himself in anger. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: No improvement ||| ‘Be beside oneself’ is a phrase which means to be in an ||| extremely emotional state. The given sentence states that the ||| person was in an extreme state of anger. Hence, option (a) is the ||| most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: She is married with a rich businessman and has enough ||| money to splurge on luxuries. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: is married to ||| ‘To’ is used after the verb ‘married’ in the passive voice. Hence, ||| 'is married to' is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Sherpas have prospered and come along the way from ||| being just porters to becoming mountaineers. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: come a long way ||| The phrase ‘come a long way’ means to make significant ||| progress or improvement. The given sentence states that ||| Sherpas have prospered and made significant progress from ||| being just porters to becoming mountaineers. Hence, ‘come a ||| long way’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: As bombs keep falling on Gaza, hundreds of thousands of ||| children have been order to flee their homes. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||

solution.content: have been ordered to flee ||| ‘Subject + has/have + been + V 3 ’ is the correct grammatical ||| structure for passive voice of Present perfect tense. ‘Ordered’ is ||| the correct third form of ‘order’. Hence, ‘have been ordered(V 3 ) to ||| flee’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 16 .(c) ought to be kept under ||| Passive voice is used when the action is performed upon the ||| subject, not by the subject. ‘Ought to + be + V 3 ’ is the correct ||| passive form. Hence, ‘ought to be kept(V 3 ) under’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: The pollution level ought to keep under control. ||| ||| ||| SSC CPO Tier II (08 / 01 / 2024) |||
He said that I have finished my work . ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 01 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: he had finished his work . ||| The given sentence is an example of indirect speech as the ||| conjunction 'that' has been used after the verb 'said'. As per the ||| rules of Indirect speech, the pronouns 'I' and ‘My’ change into ||| 'He' and ‘His’ and ‘Present perfect (have + V 3 ) changes to past ||| perfect (had + V 3 ). Hence, 'he had finished his homework' is the ||| most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Many great people born in that small village. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 01 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: were born ||| We generally use the passive voice when the subject is unknown ||| or unimportant. According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, ||| a plural subject always takes a plural verb. Similarly, ‘people’ is a ||| plural subject that will take ‘were’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘were ||| born’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: It is true that learning English is essential for professionals ||| to survived the national and international competitions. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 01 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: for surviving ||| ‘For’ is used to indicate the purpose or reason of something. ||| Similarly, the given sentence states the purpose of learning ||| English. We generally use gerund(V ing ) after a preposition(for). ||| Hence, ‘for surviving(V ing )’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Peer pressure is bound to effect most of us both positively ||| and negatively. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 04 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: to affect most of us ||| We generally use the first form of the verb(V 1 ) after the ||| preposition ‘to’. ‘Affect’ is the verb form of the noun ‘effect’. ||| Hence, ‘to affect(V 1 ) most of us’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: The pandemic has challenged education systems to ||| ensure learning continuity, substantially increasing the demands ||| placed on teachers. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 04 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: No substitution required. ||| The given sentence is grammatically correct. |||

question.content: They would find someone drive the wagon back across ||| the desert. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 04 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: to drive the ||| We generally use infinitive (To + V 1 ) to denote the purpose of ||| something. Similarly, the given sentence talks about the purpose ||| of finding someone. Hence, ‘to drive(V 1 ) the’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: The airplane flowed over the mountains, offering the ||| passengers a breath-taking view of the majestic peaks below. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 04 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: flew over ||| ‘Flew’ is the past form of ‘fly’ and ‘flowed’ means to move in a ||| current or stream. The given sentence states that the airplane ||| flew over the mountains giving passengers a stunning view of ||| the majestic peaks beneath them. Hence, ‘flew over’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Select the word segment which substitutes the bracketed ||| word correctly and completes the sentence meaningfully. ||| Mathematics (are not) easy to learn. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 04 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: is not ||| According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular ||| subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always ||| takes a plural verb. In the given sentence, ‘Mathematics’ is a ||| singular subject that will take ‘is’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘is ||||||Pinnacle ||| Sentence Improvement ||| not’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 61 .(a) added salt instead of sugar ||| ‘Alter’ means to change the form of something & ‘add’ means to ||| put in an additional element or ingredient. The word ‘added’ is a ||| more precise and clear choice in this sentence. Hence, ‘added ||| salt instead of sugar’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 62 .(a) no sooner did he finish ||| “Do/does/did + V 1 “ is the correct grammatical structure. Hence, ||| ‘no sooner did he finish’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 63 .(d) the threat to civic health ||| The phrase ‘the threat to civic health’ means the potential danger ||| or risk to the well-being and overall health of a city. Hence, ‘the ||| threat to civic health’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 64 .(d) to eat ||| ‘Too + adjective + to + V 1 ’ is the correct grammatical structure. ||| Hence, ‘to eat(V 1 )’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 65 .(c) trying to jump ||| The given sentence is an example of Present Continuous ||| Tense(Plural Sub. + are + V ing ). We generally use the preposition ||| ‘to’ with the verb ‘try’ for an activity. Hence, ‘trying(V ing ) to jump’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Mohan unknowingly altered salt instead of sugar to the ||| dessert making it taste terrible. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 05 / 09 / 2023 |||
They are sell their company's products to people. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 06 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: are selling their company's ||| We use ‘V-ing’ with the helping verb ‘is/am/are’ in the Present ||| Continuous Tense. Hence, “are selling(V-ing) their company’s” is ||| the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: You are the beautiful woman I have ever seen. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 08 / 09 / 2023 |||
Larger emissions of greenhouse gases lead to higher ||| concentrations in the atmosphere. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 08 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: No substitution required. ||| The given sentence is grammatically correct. |||

question.content: France is a largest country. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 08 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: large ||| We generally use a positive degree of adjective while describing ||| or qualifying a noun and ‘large’ is a positive degree adjective. ||| Hence, ‘large’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Very early in the morning, at the beginning of January, Opu ||| was lying in bed waiting for the sun having rose. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 12 / 09 / 2023 |||

options.text: waited for the sun having rose ||| |||
waiting for the sun to rise |||

answer: waiting for the sun to rise |||

solution.content: waiting for the sun to rise ||| We generally use the infinitive form of the verb “to + V 1 ” to ||| combine two actions. Similarly, in the given sentence, the two ||| actions are ‘waiting’ and ‘rising’. Hence, ‘waiting for the sun to ||| rise’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Newton, after seeing the apple falling from a tree, began to ||| wonder whether if it moved towards the earth and not upwards ||| towards the sky. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 12 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: began to wonder why ||| The phrase 'began to wonder why' means started thinking about ||| the reason behind the happening of some event. The given ||| sentence states that Newton started thinking about the reason ||| for the fall of the apple towards the Earth, not towards the sky. ||| Hence, 'began to wonder why' is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: They serve stuffed garlic bread and molten chocolate in ||| the birthday party of their son, Parth, last week. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 12 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: served ||| The phrase ‘last week’ indicates that the given sentence is in the ||| past tense. So, it must have the verb in the past form(V 2 ) and not ||| in the present form(serve). Hence, ‘served(V 2 )’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: If I hand her a flower and say, "Give it to mamma," she take ||| it to her mother. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: takes it ||| According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular ||| subject always takes a singular verb. Similarly, ‘she’ is a singular ||| pronoun that will take ‘takes’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘takes it’ ||| is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: The new chairman of the company announced attracted ||| bonus for the employees on the occasion of the new year. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

options.text: announced an attractive bonus for the employees ||| |||
announcing attracted bonus for the employees ||| |||
announced attracting bonus for the employees |||

answer: announced an attractive bonus for the employees ||| |||

solution.content: announced an attractive bonus for the employees ||| ‘Attracted’ must be replaced with the adjective ‘attractive’ as we ||| need to use an adjective to qualify the noun ‘bonus.’ Hence, ||| ‘ announced an attractive bonus for the employees ’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||||||Pinnacle ||| Sentence Improvement |||

question.content: Rishi asked Karan will he get a new football for him ? ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

options.text: would he get a new football for him? ||| |||
if he would get a new football for him. ||| |||
if would he get a new football for him? ||| |||
if he will get a new football for him? |||

answer: if he would get a new football for him. ||| |||

solution.content: if he would get a new football for him. ||| In indirect speech, we generally use ‘if’ while changing the ||| interrogative sentence and ‘will’ is changed into ‘would’. Also, the ||| interrogative sentence is changed into an assertive sentence. ||| Hence, ‘if he would get a new football for him’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: They said that he is not going to call them. ||| (3rd Shift) ||||||Pinnacle ||| Sentence Improvement ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

options.text: he has not gone to call then ||| |||
they are not going to call them ||| |||
he was not going to call them |||

answer: he was not going to call them |||

solution.content: he was not going to call them ||| The given sentence is in past tense so we need to use Past ||| Continuous Tense (Singular Sub. was + V 1 -ing) to make the ||| sentence grammatically correct. Hence, ‘he was not going to call ||| them’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: If you need any help tomorrow, let him knows . ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: let me know ||| ‘Let + objective case pronoun(me/him/us) + V 1 ’ is the correct ||| grammatical structure. Hence, ‘let me know(V 1 )’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Helena loves to dig and played in the dirt like any other ||| child. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: play in the dirt ||| According to the ‘Rule of Parallelism’, two or more verbs must be ||| in the same form if they are connected with one another. ||| Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘and’ connects two verbs 'dig(V 1 )’ ||| and ‘played’. Therefore, ‘play(V 1 )’ must be used in place of ||| ‘played’. Hence, ‘play in the dirt’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: The development of skills can contribute to structural ||| transformation and economic growth in enhance employability ||| and labour productivity and helping countries to become more ||| competitive. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 13 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: by enhancing employability ||| ‘By’ is a preposition that indicates the means or method by ||| which something is done. A preposition is always followed by a ||| gerund(V 1 -ing). Hence, ‘by enhancing employability’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. |||

question.content: He push the bushes aside and went a little farther. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: pushed the bushes ||| The second clause of the sentence is in past tense so we need ||| to use simple past tense(V 2 ) in the first clause. Hence, ||| ‘pushed(V 2 ) the bushes’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: I used a variety of sources to find the more cheap flight. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: cheapest ||| We generally use article ‘the’ with a superlative degree and the ||| correct superlative degree of ‘cheap’ is ‘cheapest’. Hence, ||| ‘cheapest’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: His claim to be the smartly kid in the school was a bit ||| hyperbole ! ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: smartest ||| We generally use a superlative degree adjective with the definite ||| article ‘the’. The correct superlative adjective of ‘smartly’ is ||| ‘smartest’. Hence, ‘smartest’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: The rise in temperature is playing havoc with India's ||| rainfall which is pertinent for India's agriculture sector. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: rainfall which is significant ||| ‘Significant’ means important. The given sentence states that ||| the rise in temperature is playing havoc with India’s rainfall which ||| is significant for India’s agricultural sector. Hence, ‘rainfall which ||| is significant’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Rahul's sister says that my brother is the best dancer in ||| the city . ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

options.text: her brother is the best dancer in the city ||| |||
my brother was the best dancer in the city ||| |||
her brother was the best dancer in the city ||| |||
his brother was the best dancer in the city |||

answer: her brother is the best dancer in the city ||| |||

solution.content: her brother is the best dancer in the city ||| The main subject in the sentence is ‘Rahul’s sister’ which is ||| feminine gender. ‘Her’ is used for feminine gender. Hence, ‘her ||| brother is the best dancer in the city’ is the most appropriate ||| answer. |||

question.content: A wonder in the plant kingdom, the Great Banyan Tree of ||| the AJC Bose Botanical Garden at Shibpur in Howrah, occupies a ||| unique position in the world records. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

options.text: being occupied a unique position of |||

solution.content: No improvement required. ||| The given sentence is grammatically correct. |||

question.content: It has raining very hard and he has a very large umbrella to ||| keep off the rain-drops. ||| (3rd Shift) ||| ||| SSC MTS 14 / 09 / 2023 |||

solution.content: is raining ||| Time period is not given in the sentence, so we can not use ||| Present Perfect Continuous Tense. Rather, we will use Present ||| Continuous Tense(Singular Sub. + is + V ing ) in the given ||| sentence. Hence, 'is raining' is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: I enjoy learn languages because I like them. ||| (4th Shift) ||| ||| SSC CHSL 03 / 08 / 2023 |||

solution.content: learning ||| There are certain verbs which always take a gerund(V ing ) after ||| them. These verbs include ‘love, enjoy, stop, suggest, consider, ||| etc’. Hence, ‘learning(V ing )’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: Abraham narrated Reshma his last escapade in a ||| dramatic way. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC CHSL 04 / 08 / 2023 |||

solution.content: Escapade - adventure. ||| Sol. 110 .(c) accused of beating up on the ||| The phrasal verb ‘beat up on’ means to assault or injure ||| someone by hitting repeatedly. The given sentence states that ||| Mr. Arvind faced an accusation of assaulting or beating the ||| students in the class. Hence, ‘accused of beating up on the’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 111 .(c) I would have had ||| The given sentence is an example of a third conditional ||| sentence and the correct grammatical structure for it is “If + past ||| perfect(had + V 3 ) …….. Would have + V 3 ”. Hence, ‘I would have ||| had’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 112 .(b) with their dialectical varieties ||| Possessive pronoun ‘Its’ is used for a singular noun and ‘their’ is ||| used for a plural noun. Similarly, ‘European languages’ is a plural ||| noun and it will take ‘their’ with it. Hence, ‘with their dialectical ||| varieties’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 113 .(a) finish the marathon in record time ||| The phrase ‘in record time’ means within a remarkably short ||| amount of time. Preposition ‘In’ specifies the time frame for the ||| action of finishing the marathon. Hence, ‘finish the marathon in ||| record time’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 114 .(a) more brave than intelligent ||| When there is a comparison between two qualities of a single ||| person or thing, we do not use normal comparative degree. E.g.- ||| more smart than beautiful(not ‘smarter than beautiful’). Similarly, ||| the given sentence compares two qualities, ‘bravery’ and ||| ‘intelligence’ of Himanshu. Hence, ‘more brave than intelligent’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 115 .(b) nothing else ||| ‘Nothing else’ is used to emphasize a quality or feature that one ||| has. Similarly, in the given sentence, there is emphasis on the ||| quality of pride. Hence, ‘nothing else’ is the most appropriate ||| answer. ||| Sol. 116 .(a) has not been and can never be ||| ‘Singular Sub. + has + V 3 ’ and ‘Modal(can) + V 1 ’ is the correct ||| grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘has not ||| been(V 3 ) and can never be(V,)’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 117 .(c) has the prospect ||| According to the ‘Subject-Verb Agreement Rule’, a singular ||| subject always takes a singular verb. In the given sentence, ||| ‘integration’ is a singular subject that will take ‘has’ as a singular ||| verb. Hence, ‘has the prospect’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 118 .(d) Our teachers have planned a picnic ||| According to the “Subject-Verb ||| Agreement Rule”, a plural subject always takes a plural verb. ||| In the given sentence, ‘our teachers’ is a plural subject that will ||| take ‘have’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘Our teachers have planned a ||| picnic’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 119 .(a) due to his hard work and dedication ||| ‘Their’ is used for plural nouns whereas ‘his’ is used for singular ||| nouns of common gender. In the given sentence, ‘the new ||| employees’ is a singular noun of common gender. Hence, ‘due to ||| his hard work and dedication’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 120 .(a) for the last several years ||| ‘Since’ is used to denote a point of time like since 1960. ‘For’ is ||| used for a fixed period of time(countable) like 2 years/3 ||| months/4 days/8 hours. Hence, ‘for the last several years’ is the ||| most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 121 .(a) from one and all in the country and abroad ||| The phrase ‘one and all’ conveys the idea that he received ||| appreciation from everyone. Also, article ‘the’ will be used before ||| the country. Hence, ‘from one and all in the country and abroad’ ||| is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 122 .(b) No correction required. ||| The given sentence is grammatically correct. ||| Sol. 123 .(c) continued to study for his upcoming exam ||| The given sentence contains a verb in past form i.e. “was ||| exhausted” so we will use simple past tense(V 2 ) in the latter ||| part. Hence, ‘continued to study for his upcoming exam’ is the ||| most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 124 .(b) did not call ||| ‘Yesterday’ denotes an action that happened in the past. So, we ||| need to use simple past tense(V 2 ) to make the sentence ||| grammatically correct. Hence, ‘did not call’ is the most ||||||Pinnacle ||| Sentence Improvement ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 125 .(c) Prefigure - to give an advance indication or warning ||| of something. ||| Predict - to forecast or foretell an event or outcome. ||| Deliberate - to think carefully and consider all aspects before ||| making a decision. ||| Precipitate - to cause something to happen suddenly or ||| unexpectedly. ||| Proliferate - to cause something to happen suddenly or ||| unexpectedly. ||| Sol. 126 .(b) found everywhere in a huge amount ||| The phrase "found everywhere in a huge amount" conveys the ||| same meaning more clearly and grammatically. Hence, ‘found ||| everywhere in a huge amount’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 127 .(c) guests are gathered by ||| We use plural nouns after ‘all’ and the preposition ‘by’ means ||| near or close to something. Hence, ‘guests are gathered by’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 128 .(a) the newly released books ||| ‘Released’ means to make something available for public use & ||| ‘realised’ means to become aware of or understand something. ||| The phrase ‘the newly released books’ means the new books ||| which are now available for the public. Hence, ‘the newly ||| released books’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 129 .(c) Reprehensible ||| ‘Reprehensible’ means deserving blame or strong criticism & ||| ‘Ignominious’ means deserving shame or disgrace. The given ||| sentence states that the fall of Ranjith for the petty material ||| benefit was really deserving of shame. Hence, ‘reprehensible’ is ||| the most appropriate answer. |||

solution.content: in the movie theater was reduced ||| ‘The number of + plural noun + Singular Verb’ is the correct ||| grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘in the ||| movie theater was reduced’ is the most appropriate answer. |||

question.content: I need to put out my clothes before I leave for work this ||| morning otherwise, I will be restless when I return. ||| (1st Shift) ||| ||| SSC CHSL 10 / 08 / 2023 |||

question.content: The newly admitted students has been given a pair of ||| uniforms by the management. ||| (2nd Shift) ||| ||| SSC CHSL 10 / 08 / 2023 |||

solution.content: have been given a pair ||| According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular ||| subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always ||| takes a plural verb. ‘Students’ is a plural subject that will take ||| ‘have’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘have been given a pair’ is the ||| most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 140 .(d) building up inside her ||| The phrase ‘building up’ means becoming stronger or more ||| intense. Hence, ‘building up inside her’ is the most appropriate ||| answer. ||| Sol. 141 .(b) at the moment ||| The phrase ‘at the moment’ means ‘right now’ or ‘currently.’ ||| Hence, ‘at the moment’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 142 .(d) that are abundant ||| ‘Abundant’ means available in large quantities. Hence, ‘that are ||| abundant‘’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 143 .(a) I think ||| ‘Simple Present tense’ is used to express the act of thinking ||| about a future action. Hence, ‘I think’ is the most appropriate ||| answer. ||| Sol. 144 .(c) if he expresses ||| The given sentence is an example of Type 1 conditional and the ||| correct grammatical structure is “if + simple present…….will +V 1 ”. ||| Hence ‘if he expresses’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 145 .(c) you are wishing to watch ||| The phrase ‘would like to’ is a polite way of expressing our ||| preference or intention to do or have something. Similarly, we ||| use the phrase ‘wish to’ to express our desire or intention to do ||| something. Hence, ‘you are wishing to watch’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 146 .(b) inspired them to continue pursuing their ||| The given sentence is in the simple past tense so the verb must ||| be used in the simple past form(V 2 ). However, the past form of ||| ‘inspire’ is ‘inspired’. Hence, ‘ inspired(V 2 ) them to continue ||| pursuing their ’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 147 .(a) accordance with ||| ‘In accordance with’ is the correct phrase. ‘In accordance with’ ||| means following or obeying a rule, law or advice. Hence, ||| ‘accordance with’ is the most appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 148 .(b) but it is impossible ||||||Pinnacle ||| Sentence Improvement ||| We generally use the conjunction ‘but’ to express a different ||| opinion or idea. Hence, ‘but it is impossible’ is the most ||| appropriate answer. ||| Sol. 149 .(b) Everyone was sincerely and positively ||| ‘Everyone /each/ every/ nothing/ everything/ anything/ either/ ||| neither’ represents a singular noun. Therefore, singular verbs will ||| be used with them. Hence, ‘Everyone was sincerely and ||| positively’ is the most appropriate answer. |||
